page.title: 08HOW I USE THE AREA
page.content: NICOLA LESLEY EVANS aged 11 I get up at about 7.30 a.m. mosdt mornings. I have one brother, Carl. I also have six dogs. I often go to the Crymlyn Bog and the area around the old Tir John power station to play or exercise the dogs. Thirty years ago, when my mother was just a baby, my gran and most of the people of Port Tennant complained to the Council about the unhealthy atmosphere they were living in. They could not put their washing on the line when there wasn't an easterly wind blowing _ they would look as if they had been sprinkled with soot. Today the Carbon Black Co. and the power station have both gone, but there is still a bit of pollution where they used to be. People still tip their rubbish here. Children and animals could cut themselves and rats are found.
